content.question: Which of the diagrams above best represents the interactions that are responsible for the relatively large solubility of <math alttext="K C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> crystals in water, and why?

choices.label: Diagram 1, because strong ion-dipole interactions between <math alttext="K C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and water help to dissociate the solute.

Diagram 1, because strong London dispersion forces between the <math alttext="K with a positive one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions and water replace the weak London dispersion forces between two water molecules.

Diagram 2, because strong dipole-dipole forces between <math alttext="K C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and water help to separate the <math alttext="K C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> units within the crystals.

Diagram 2, because the hydrogen bonds between water molecules expand to accommodate the <math alttext="K C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> particles and pull them into solution.

content.answer: Diagram 1, because strong ion-dipole interactions between <math alttext="K C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and water help to dissociate the solute.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
